result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Allen Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant shall report on or before 2pm on November 1, 2022.
Work release granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark Allen Moore in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Mark Allen Moore.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, State moves to amend Ct 1 to neglecting a child. State will recommend probation with conditional jail. Court grants amendment. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation with the following conditions: 10 days jail, with work release, report on or before 11/1/22 at 2pm, to pay court costs, not to possess or consume any alcohol, to have such programming, counseling, treatment, and assessment that DOC deems appropriate, and to submit a DNA sample.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark Allen Moore not in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Mark Allen Moore.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mickelson heard on defendant's non appearance. Court heard on status of trial. Attorney Riniker and Attorney Mickelson are ready to proceed to trial. Trial date set.
